pkgmetadata.longdescription: Chi-Square and Exact Tests for Non-Parametric Functional Dependencies // Statistical hypothesis testing methods for non- parametric functional dependencies using asymptotic chi-square or exact statistics. Functional chi-squares are asymmetric and functional optimal, unique from other related statistics. These tests reveal evidence for causality based on the causality-by- functionality principle. They include asymptotic functional chi-square tests, an exact functional test, a comparative functional chi-square test, and also a comparative chi-square test. The normalized non-constant functional chi-square test was used by Best Performer NMSUSongLab in HPN-DREAM (DREAM8) Breast Cancer Network Inference Challenges. For continuous data, these tests offer an advantage over regression analysis when a parametric functional form cannot be assumed; for categorical data, they provide a novel means to assess directional dependencies not possible with symmetrical Pearson's chi-square or Fisher's exact tests.
